data.type_: str or `.Artist` or `.Transform` or callable or (float, float), default: value of *xycoords*

data.value: The properties used to draw a
.  Defaults to None, i.e. no arrow is drawn.
For historical reasons there are two different ways to specify arrows, "simple" and "fancy":
does not contain the key 'arrowstyle' the allowed keys are:

==========   ====================================================== Key          Description ==========   ====================================================== width        The width of the arrow in points headwidth    The width of the base of the arrow head in points headlength   The length of the arrow head in points shrink       Fraction of total length to shrink from both ends ?            Any key to
The arrow is attached to the edge of the text box, the exact position (corners or centers) depending on where it's pointing to.
This is used if 'arrowstyle' is provided in the

===============  ================================================== Key              Description ===============  ================================================== arrowstyle       the arrow style connectionstyle  the connection style relpos           see below; default is (0.5, 0.5) patchA           default is bounding box of the text patchB           default is None shrinkA          default is 2 points shrinkB          default is 2 points mutation_scale   default is text size (in points) mutation_aspect  default is 1. ?                any key for
The exact starting point position of the arrow is defined by

. It's a tuple of relative coordinates of the text box, where (0, 0) is the lower left corner and (1, 1) is the upper right corner. Values <0 and >1 are supported and specify points outside the text box. By default (0.5, 0.5) the starting point is centered in the text box.
